snippet: The case against Arab Bank could set a precedent, opening up banks to liability for transactions linked to criminals, and giving victims a potent way to seek compensation.
abstract: Plaintiffs in case against Arab Bank lay out their case in federal court in Brooklyn, accusing bank of knowingly financing Hamas; plaintiffs totally almost 300 are victims or family members of victims of 24 terrorist attacks in early 2000s linked to Hamas; case is first civil trial against bank under Antiterrorism Act.
lead_paragraph: The case against Arab Bank could set a precedent, opening up banks to liability for transactions linked to criminals, and giving victims a potent way to seek compensation.

headline.main: Hamas Transactions Got Through in Error, Bank Says
headline.print_headline: Hamas Transactions Got Through in Error, Bank Says
